TopicTitle: All of america's rockets! Community project! We need more builders! Join now!

Articles.Content:
First of all, please make crafts which others are making too! I already have 2 Saturn Vs, it would be great to see your versions of those too!

And, that looks amazing! I only need a description, and I'll add it.

Also, Yukon0009, those poor Rhinos! They have been nerfed so hard ASL! That Delta IV heavy is great, but it has a TWR of 1.0, I'll be changing that a bit, if you don't mind.

Will do. I made a Delta IV back in .90 I have an album of me landing it on the Mun with no fuel. *Dont question that* It wont be hard to replicate that beauty. All these American Crafts I made in .90. Im going to try to load them up in 1.0.2 and see if they still work or if I have to make an entirely new version . Glad to be part of 'Murica

Okay, so that Delta IV heavy seems to be broken, no way to get a high enough TWR with the throttle/ISP scaling.

The PGM-19 Jupiter works fine, since you're off of the forums for a bit, I'll write a description for you, if you want the description changed, just say.

Hey, hey I finally got the Delta IV working properly. Unfortunately, pitch is A and D not too bad because when you reach orbit it changes the W and S for pitch so probably on launch you could set it to orbit already. Anyways, the new aero and thrust distribution make the craft completely unstable. Thankfully, flight instructions go as so: Full throttle, first stage: All engines fire, dont turn just go straight up, decouple boosters after done, you should be around 30,000 meters in the atmosphere, turn 90 degrees and burn parallel, continue to burn parallel until it runs out of fuel, decouple main booster, wait for periapsis (Should be around 1,000,000 meters +) Burn to orbit, should have way more delta v to go to minmus and back with that stage, decouple, DSP-23 satellite deployed. Insert Smiley face here:

Final Product:

Should be releasing tommorow. In the meantime, I got something else to do

I just sort of condense the first paragraph of the wiki page on the rocket.

I just sort of condense the first paragraph of the wiki page on the rocket.

Here you go!

The Delta IV Heavy, initially launched in 2004 it established the first operational payload known as the DSP-23 Satellite utilized for the National Reconnaissance Office. It has 1/5 of the thrust in comparison to the Saturn V Rocket and was primarily used for the Orion project. Costing over 375 million dollars, this historical rocket can lift over 30 tons of a payload. Lastly, it is prominently known as the WorldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Largest Rocket.

Ares 1 Download is ready

.https://www.dropbox.com/s/fgbdv9ldbdrh67p/Ares%201.craft?dl=0

Description: The Ares 1 Space Module. As a key component to the constellation program, it will be the replacement of the space shuttle, capable of lifting 24,500 Kilograms into LEO. This two stage rocket will be the foundation for the Ares V to send supplies to sustain human life on MARS. Towering over 94 meters tall, this rocket was named after Greek God Ares. Lockheed Martin proudly participate in the Lockheed Martin and looks toward a bright future in 2030.

Since some people liked it and since both Atlas and Redstone still need more work I can offer Little Joe to the thread.

Little Joe

Description: Little Joe was a solid-fueled rocket used to test the heat shield and LES system for Project Mercury. A successor rocket, the Little Joe II was used for the same purposes in the Apollo program.

Updated the Gemini and The Saturn V

I made a Little Joe II:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
The Little Joe II was a research rocket used to test the Apollo launch escape system at various points, including max Q http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Joe_II

Instructions: Just plonk it out on the launchpad, hit space to launch and then press backspace (abort) whenever you want to test the LES. When you're clear of the rocket, mash space until the parachutes deploy.

Dowload: https://www.dropbox.com/s/e40xck5r49k5xvh/Little%20Joe%20II.craft?dl=0
